results.title: Michael Collins
results.creator_credit: Neil Jordan, Redmond Morris, Stephen Woolley and Geffen Pictures
results.brief_description: Ireland 1916, His dreams inspired hope, his words ignited passion and his courage forged a nation’s destiny. “Michael Collins” (Liam Neeson) is the story of a real-life patriot whose bravery and unswerving dedication to the Irish people changed history as it made him into a legend. Collins quest would bring a man raised on war into an even more dangerous battle for peace. It would cost him his life and make him a hero for the ages. This film encompasses romance, violence, valour, rage, burning hope and fiery tragedy. The performances given by Liam Neeson, Alan Rickman, Stephen Rea, Julia Roberts, Aidan Quinn and Charles Dance are superb and linger long after the movie finishes.

results.title: Michael Casson, studio potter
results.brief_description: The stoneware of Michael Casson has won international acclaim. The stages in making one pot are described, and many fine examples of the potter’s completed work are shown in his Buckinghamshire workshop. Casson provides his own commentary: “Pottery is really my whole life”.

results.title: Michael and the flying boats
results.brief_description: The aim of this film is to convey to children the excitement and interest connected with air transport. It shows the adventures and investigations of a small boy at an airport as he watches the departure of a flying boat for South Africa, and illustrates the work of the ground staff and air crew, the organisation of the airport, and some details of the structure and mechanism of the flying boat.

results.title: Michael
results.creator_credit: Nora Ephron, James Jacks, Sean Daniel and Turner Pictures
results.brief_description: When Frank Quinlan (William Hurt) is sent by a tabloid newspaper to investigate the appearance of an angel in a sleepy town in rural Iowa, he and his co-workers Huey Driscoll(Robert Pastorelli) and Dorothy Winters (Andie MacDowell) are surprised to find a chain smoking overweight beerdrinking battle-axe. But as Micheal (John Travolta) explains, he’s not that kind of angel. Soon the three reporters are off on a road trip with the archangel Micheal as they attempt to get him back to Chicago and grab the story of a lifetime. Nora Ephron directs this sweet romance, with Travolta utilising his screen charisma to create an engaging angel.

results.title: Mice Milking
results.brief_description:
Please be advised: this film contains scenes of animal restraint that some viewers may find disturbing.

This film, made by the Victorian Department of Agriculture, documents the process by which mice are milked in a laboratory at the Safe Research Farm in Werribee, for use in cancer research. The narrator explains that in mice, leukemia and mammary cancer are similar to cancer in humans and the virus is present in their milk. The mice milking machine in use in the film was developed by research officer Graeme Mein for demonstration in an open day at Werribee, based on those used by the National Cancer Institute, USA. The film shows laboratory technicians attaching a mouse to the machine and milking them.

results.title: Mice but no men
results.brief_description: The autobiography of a mouse. We follow his adventures from the first timid adventures beyond his nest; the first “apartment” in a shoe; his contact with the outside world and the farm yard animals, including a large tabby cat.
results.description: The autobiography of a mouse. We follow his adventures from the first timid adventures beyond his nest; the first “apartment” in a shoe; his contact with the outside world and the farm yard animals, including a large tabby cat.

results.title: Mice and men
results.brief_description: Examines differing social patterns of mice and insects, and indicates similarities between mice and men. Discusses instinctive behaviour, relationships, social dominance and how man’s intervention can alter this dominance. Looks also at aggression and the prevention of unlimited aggression. Spoken by Brian Inglis and Bob Holness. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Mice and how they live
results.brief_description: Cactus mice are used to indicate typical behaviour of mice, but this species is atypical in that it does not need to drink. Close-up photography is used to reveal habitat, food, physical description and behaviour of mice. English verion of German motion picture.

results.title: Miami rhapsody
results.creator_credit: David Frankel, Barry Jossen and Hollywood Pictures
results.brief_description: This hilariously sexy comedy has critics everywhere standing and cheering! The irresistible Sarah Jessica Parker (Honeymoon in Vegas, L.A. story) stars as Gwyn Marcus - a recently-engaged young woman about to make a shockingly funny discovery: marriage and fidelity don’t always go hand-in-hand, especially in her own family! From then on, it’s comical chaos as one by one, Gwyn unravels the details of their outrageously tangled affairs. Stars Sarah Jessica Parker, Mia Farrow, and Antonio Banderas.
